isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: HOLSET SS 296 AND QE 296/338 - INSTALL

warning.para: When any component is serviced or installed on the air system, be sure to set the parking brake and block the vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.
Do not attempt to install or reassemble components with air pressure in the system. Be sure the system was drained of air pressure before installing components to avoid personal injury or death.

step1.para: Inspect the drive gear and related parts for wear or damage. If any parts are found to be worn or damaged, they must be replaced ( Figure 97).
Use a press to push the drive gear onto the crankshaft, with the part number side out, until the back side of the gear bottoms against the crankshaft shoulder ( Figure 98).

figure.caption: Figure 98. Push Drive Gear Unto Crankshaft

caution.para: Do not exceed 12,000 ft-lbs. (53,378 N•m) load. Excessive load can bend the crankshaft.

step1.para: With the drive gear pressed onto the compressor crankshaft, install the drive gear retaining bolt and washer ( Figure 99). Tighten to 75 ft-lbs. (100 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 99. Install Drive Gear Retaining Bolt and Washer

step1.para: Position the compressor on the engine.
Unplug all air, water and oil lines leading to the compressor and reconnect as labeled during removal.
Check the oil level. Add oil if low or if oil was drained during service.
Refill engine cooling system. Check to assure cooling system is properly filled.
Charge the air system and check for leaks.
Test the vehicle before returning it to service.
